Posts.Content: Thank you for replying. Yes, after listening to the oncologist it was the logical thing to do. I’m going to join the chemo group, I’m sure it will help.
Posts.Title: Irrational fear

Posts.Content: Thank you, I didn’t know about the chemo group and I’m sure it will help me.
Posts.Title: Irrational fear

Posts.Content: My late husband had AML, but sadly died from an infection which he had no immune system to fight. I had a mastectomy on July 11th. It was successful, the cancer hasn’t spread, but I am having a course of chemotherapy which starts on August 24th.  I can’t get it out of my mind that it was the chemotherapy which caused Alan’s death, even though I know it was the leukaemia.  I feel, quite irrationally scared at the thought of chemotherapy, even though I know it’s the right thing for me to do. Feeling very small and alone, in spite of family, friends and my church who are all supporting me so much.
Posts.Title: Irrational fear
